whatIsService.title: What Is Mole Removal Treatment?
whatIsService.content:
Mole removal is a safe, minor surgical procedure that removes unwanted moles, skin tags, or other benign skin growths. Whether for cosmetic reasons or medical concerns, professional mole removal ensures minimal scarring and optimal healing.

Moles can appear anywhere on the body and may change over time. While most moles are harmless, some may require removal due to changes in size, color, or texture, or simply because they affect your confidence or comfort.

At The Skin Firm, our mole removal procedures are performed with precision and care. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Karishma Singh, we use advanced techniques to ensure safe removal with minimal scarring and excellent cosmetic outcomes.

signsSymptoms.title: When to Consider Mole Removal
items: Moles that have changed in size, color, or shape
Moles that bleed, itch, or become painful
Large or raised moles that catch on clothing
Moles in visible areas affecting confidence
Moles with multiple colors or rough texture

faqs.title: FAQs on Mole Removal in Pune

questions.question: Is mole removal painful?
questions.answer: The procedure is performed under local anesthesia, so you'll feel minimal discomfort during removal. Some mild soreness may occur for a few days after the procedure.

questions.question: Will there be a scar after mole removal?
questions.answer: While some scarring is normal, we use advanced techniques to minimize scarring. Most scars fade significantly over time and become barely noticeable.

questions.question: How long does the mole removal procedure take?
questions.answer: Most mole removal procedures take 15-30 minutes, depending on the size and location of the mole. It's typically done as an outpatient procedure.

questions.question: When can I return to normal activities?
questions.answer: Most patients can return to normal activities immediately, with some restrictions on heavy lifting or strenuous exercise for a few days.

questions.question: Do I need to have the mole tested?
questions.answer: Depending on the mole's characteristics, we may recommend histopathological examination to ensure it's benign. This provides additional peace of mind.
